title: The New Michael Jordan of Quake/Doom?
body: Tom's Hardware points out a bunch of cool shit at <a href="http://www.tomshardware.com/game/20040821/index.html">QuakeCon 2004</a>.  The Fatal1ty Quake 3 champion dude has not only his own <a href="http://www.tomshardware.com/game/20040821/quakecon_2004-06.html">booth babes</a>, but Abit has licensed the Fatal1ty name for a line of products - basically the Air Jordans of the computing world.  There was a <a href="http://www.tomshardware.com/game/20040821/quakecon_2004-07.html">shootout against him</a> that sounds like it was a pretty awesome deathmatch.  The winner, Daler,  got a bunch of stuff.  Then they had some crazy Quake 3 and Doom 3 double-elimination tournaments with prizes of $25K, $15K, and $12K for the top three in each one.  It sounds like it was pretty cool.
bodyArticleHtml:
